entry.title: Unquoted Service Path Vulnerability
entry.summary: What is Unquoted Service Path ? Unquoted Service Path is a vulnerability that occurs when a service is created with a service path without appropriate quoting surrounding the path string, and if the path contains spaces, that can end up with a privilege escalation with the permissions of whoever created the service. How it works ? Typically Service Control Manager will run the service’s exec...

entry.title: Tryhackme Steel Mountain CTF Writeup
entry.summary: Solve Yourself » The steel mountain is a windows machine. In order to hack into the machine, we are going to exploit two different vulnerabilities that occur on the system. FIRST METHOD 1-Preperation Export the ip address of the machine as a variable for shorthand usage. -> export ip={MACHINE IP} 2-Enumeration Let us run Network Mapper (nmap) to discover opened ports and services. ...

entry.title: Add Windows Boot Manager to Grub

link.title: Add Windows Boot Manager to Grub

entry.summary: If you want to add windows boot manager to grub, follow these steps; 1-Download os-prober 2-Run sudo os-prober If you see something like that, you are good to go. -> sudo os-prober /dev/nvme1n1p1@/EFI/Microsoft/Boot/bootmgfw.efi:Windows Boot Manager:Windows:efi 3- Add this line, GRUB_DISABLE_OS_PROBER=false, at the end of the /etc/default/grub file. 4- Run sudo grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub...

entry.title: IPv4 Protocol
entry.summary: IPv4 IPv4 stands for Internet Protocol version 4. IPs are addresses for users on the internet. Messages and packages delivered via IP addresses. IPv4 address spaces consists of four octets. Depending on the class and configuration, some portion of bits in the octet represents the network ID, while the rest represents hosts. An IP address consists of 4 octets, which determines the class and co...

entry.title: Subnetting
entry.summary: WHAT IS SUBNETTING ? As the name suggest, subnetting means dividing a network into sub sub branches. For example, you have a class with 50 students, if you divide them into two groups, you will have two subclasses, 25 students per class. Subetting is just the same however, instead of class, this time it is the network which is going to be divided into smaller chunks. WHY USING SUBNETTING ? S...
